guide.introduction: In this guide we use a Halloween skeleton mask, an Arduino Duemilanove, a servo and some LEDs to create the ultimate skeleton Halloween decoration.
guide.introduction_rendered:
In this guide we use a Halloween skeleton mask, an Arduino Duemilanove, a servo and some LEDs to create the ultimate skeleton Halloween decoration.

Relevant parts
  • Arduino Duemilanove
  • Servo (generic)
  • Breadboard kit
  • Halloween mask
  • LEDs

lines.text: Attach your servo to your mask. You may need to add wood or something for support.
lines.text_raw: Attach your servo to your mask. You may need to add wood or something for support.

lines.text: Optional : Add LEDs in the eyes.
lines.text_raw: Optional : Add LEDs in the eyes.

lines.text: If you add LEDs the positive/red goes to the Arduino's pin 13 and the negative/black/ground goes to the ground pin.
lines.text_raw: If you add LEDs the positive/red goes to the Arduino's pin 13 and the negative/black/ground goes to the ground pin.

lines.text: Now let's wire up the servo to our Arduino.
lines.text_raw: Now let's wire up the servo to our Arduino.

lines.text: The Black wire goes to a ground pin.
lines.text_raw: The Black wire goes to a ground pin.

lines.text: The Yellow/White/Orange goes to digital pin 9.
lines.text_raw: The Yellow/White/Orange goes to digital pin 9.

lines.text: Now plug your Arduino in and type this code:
lines.text_raw: Now plug your Arduino in and type this code:

lines.text: <tt>// THIS IS FOR NO LEDs.                               #include <Servo.h>    Servo myservo;  // create servo object to control       void setup()  {    myservo.attach(9);  // attaches servo to pin 9 }   void loop()  {    myservo.write(90);//Degree 1 to 180   delay(1000);     //Time in milliseconds  myservo.write(180);//Degree 1 to 180   delay(1000);     //Time in milliseconds    myservo.write(90);//Degree 1 to 180   delay(1000);     //Time in milliseconds }</tt>
lines.text_raw: ``// THIS IS FOR NO LEDs.                               #include <Servo.h>    Servo myservo;  // create servo object to control       void setup()  {    myservo.attach(9);  // attaches servo to pin 9 }   void loop()  {    myservo.write(90);//Degree 1 to 180   delay(1000);     //Time in milliseconds  myservo.write(180);//Degree 1 to 180   delay(1000);     //Time in milliseconds    myservo.write(90);//Degree 1 to 180   delay(1000);     //Time in milliseconds }``

lines.text: To add LEDs just add the code from the Arduino example called "blink."
lines.text_raw: To add LEDs just add the code from the Arduino example called "blink."
